title.english: Sekai Ichi Hatsukoi - The World's Greatest First Love

description: Onodera Ritsu has just transferred from his father's publishing company to Marukawa Shoten. Assigned to the shoujo manga division, he crosses path with the person he'd least expected to meet. Takano Masamune is the editor-in-chief of the division Ritsu's been assigned to, and the two seem get off on the wrong foot right from the very start when Takano unexpectedly kisses him. However, there is more to than what meets the eye: Takano is actually Saga, Ritsu's senpai and high school love, whom Ritsu had thought to have played him for a fool by taking his affections for granted when he confessed and summarily dumped him.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

title.native: 世界一初恋 ~小野寺律の場合~
劇場版 世界一初恋 横澤隆史の場合

node.description:
__Doujin Circle:__ SPICCA

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/marukawashoten)

Shungiku is a Japanese manga artist, known for her yaoi manga [Junjou Romantica](https://anilist.co/manga/30765/Junjou-Romantica) and [Sekaiichi Hatsukoi](https://anilist.co/manga/40573/Sekaiichi-Hatsukoi-Onodera-Ritsu-no-Baai).
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

edges.role: Theme Song Performance (ending song ~ "Ashita Boku wa Kimi ni Ai ni Yuku")

He won Anison Grand Prix and went to sing opening themes for Persona -trinity soul- and Natsume Yuujinchou.
His first single 'Breakin' through' debuted at #26 on the Oricon ranking chart for CD singles in March.
He also performs Persona 3 Portable opening theme, Soul Phase, and Love Lebo Portable theme song, Secret Garden.
A Japanese anime director, storyboard artist, and animator.
A Japanese anime director, storyboard artist, and animator.

__[Profile (Peak A Soul)](https://www.peakasoul.net/anze)__

__Hijiri Anze__ is a Japanese pianist, lyricist, composer and arranger. She was a co-composer of music for the game Resident Evil Code: Veronica.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/makoto_myzk) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/宮崎誠)

A music creator for the creative music unit [(K)NoW_NAME](https://anilist.co/staff/126602/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/makoto_myzk) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/宮崎誠)

A music creator for the creative music unit [(K)NoW_NAME](https://anilist.co/staff/126602/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/325492584) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=tatsuya_yoshihara)

Freelance animator formerly affiliated with [Actas](https://anilist.co/studio/60/) where he was attending its internal animation school and debuted as animator at the age of 20. His work has been greatly influenced by contemporary Kanada school animators [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/) and [Hironori Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/103979/). 

He's a precocious talent, debuting as episode director at the age of 21 and as director at the age of 23 with [Arve Rezzle](https://anilist.co/anime/13863/), as part of the Young Animator Training Project.

Married to fellow animator [Kikuko Sadakata](https://anilist.co/staff/105769).
